thread.title: Davis Cup: Denis Shapovalov fined over Great Britain default
thread.title_full: Davis Cup: Denis Shapovalov fined over Great Britain default

title: Davis Cup: Denis Shapovalov fined over Great Britain default
text:
Media playback is not supported on this device Shapovalov hits umpire in face and loses Davis Cup tie Canada's Denis Shapovalov has been fined $7,000 (Â£5,600) after being defaulted from his match against Great Britain's Kyle Edmund in the Davis Cup. 
The 17-year-old was down 3-6 4-6 1-2 when he hit the umpire in the eye with a ball struck in anger. 
He must pay $2,000 for the default and $5,000 for unsportsmanlike conduct, escaping the maximum $10,000 penalty as it was not deemed intentional. 
The International Tennis Federation could still take further action. 
More to follow.
